metadata.description: Foundational essays documenting the core arguments, evidence chains, and legal analysis for Thomson v NHS Providers

essays.title: Somatoform Contamination: The Covert Diagnosis
essays.subtitle: How a Psychiatric Label Was Applied Without Assessment, Knowledge, or Basis
essays.summary: Documents how Dr Bulale Ali applied Somatoform Pain Disorder (F45.4) during a telephone consultation about opioid medication switching on 5 January 2023 - after MRI had confirmed T5-T8 vertebral fractures. The patient was never informed. The diagnosis was later removed by Dr Gorrie in July 2025 with the note 'there were clear causes for his pain.'
keyArguments: Psychiatric diagnosis applied without psychiatric assessment
Applied after objective pathology (vertebral fractures) confirmed on imaging
Patient never informed of diagnosis
Wrong ICD-10 code used (E278 instead of F45.4) suggesting unfamiliarity
Independently removed by subsequent GP as self-evidently inappropriate
Pain Clinic explicitly refuted somatoform characterisation

essays.title: The 10-Month Diagnostic Delay
essays.subtitle: How T5-T8 Vertebral Fractures Went Undiagnosed Despite Red Flag Presentation
essays.summary: Documents the 10-month delay in diagnosing T5-T8 vertebral fractures from the December 2021 seizure until MRI confirmation in October 2022. Initial A&E assessment dismissed the injury as 'soft tissue' despite NICE NG59 red flag presentation. The delay was compounded by imaging the wrong spinal region (lumbar instead of thoracic).
keyArguments: NICE NG59 red flags present but not actioned
Initial A&E dismissed injury as 'soft tissue'
Wrong spinal region imaged (lumbar MRI when thoracic was symptomatic)
Patient discharged from Neurospine because 'no surgical target' - on lumbar MRI
10 months of undiagnosed vertebral fractures caused prolonged suffering
Thoracic MRI eventually confirmed T5-T8 fractures

essays.title: Medication Causation: Pregabalin Withdrawal and Seizure
essays.subtitle: How Abrupt Pregabalin Reduction Led to the Index Seizure Event
essays.summary: Documents the causation chain linking abrupt pregabalin reduction (600mg to 100mg) in October 2021 to the seizure event on 23 December 2021. BNF guidance mandates gradual withdrawal over minimum 1 week. Dr Simeoni documented: 'When had a seizure pregabalin had been stopped abruptly.' The patient now has a formal epilepsy diagnosis.
keyArguments: BNF mandates gradual pregabalin withdrawal - not followed
Reduction from 600mg to 100mg in 2-3 days
Independent specialist documented seizure occurred when pregabalin stopped abruptly
Sleep deprivation (14+ months) lowered seizure threshold
Patient later diagnosed with epilepsy (not dissociative/functional seizures)
Pattern repeated: GP stopped OxyContin unsafely despite Pain Clinic warning of seizure risk

essays.title: The Vindication Evidence
essays.subtitle: Independent Specialist Confirmations That Refute Psychiatric Framing
essays.summary: Compiles the independent specialist statements that vindicate John Thomson's physical symptoms and refute the psychiatric/functional framing. Dr Karunaratne: 'medical explanations have been found.' Dr Gorrie removed somatoform noting 'clear causes for his pain.' Pain Clinic stated somatoform was 'NOT their opinion.' Multiple imaging studies confirm TOS over 6 years.
keyArguments: Dr Gorrie independently removed somatoform diagnosis
Pain Clinic explicitly disagreed with somatoform characterisation
Dr Karunaratne: 'medical explanations have been found for symptoms'
Formal epilepsy diagnosis (not NEAD/functional seizures)
POTS diagnosis refuted by cardiologist - 'test did not show this'
TOS confirmed on imaging over 6-year timeline (2019, 2024, 2025)
Psychiatric assessment found NO mental health disorders

essays.title: Practice Manager Conduct
essays.subtitle: Non-Clinical Decisions With Clinical Consequences
essays.summary: Documents the conduct of practice manager Clive Polles in making clinical decisions without clinical authority. iMessage evidence shows direct involvement in medication decisions. Dr Gorrie referenced 'sketchy stuff' that blocked a practice merger. Medication refused 4 days before the December 2021 seizure.
keyArguments: Practice manager made clinical decisions without clinical qualifications
Medication refused 4 days before index seizure event
Direct text messages from Polles to patient/family about clinical matters
Current GP referenced 'sketchy stuff' blocking practice merger
'Off the books' calls to patient's mother with disprovable claims
Non-clinical staff influencing care pathways

essays.title: Thoracic Outlet Syndrome: The Ongoing Delay
essays.subtitle: Six Years of Documented Vascular Pathology
essays.summary: Documents the 6+ year timeline of Thoracic Outlet Syndrome from first positive Doppler in June 2019 through subsequent confirmatory imaging in 2024 and 2025. Despite objective evidence of vascular compression, the condition has not received definitive surgical intervention. Patient symptom severity documented: 'would rather his arm be amputated.'
keyArguments: First positive Doppler June 2019 - 'marked haemodynamic changes'
2024 MR confirms dynamic subclavian compression
2025 Doppler: bilateral subclavian veins 'compressed with no flow'
Radiologist: 'TOS cannot be excluded' with static imaging
MRA confirms compression and focal stenosis
Specialist documents extreme suffering - patient prefers amputation
6+ years of documented pathology without definitive intervention

correctionLog.change: FND/Somatoform distinction clarified. FND Tremor WAS assessed (methodology disputed); Somatoform Pain Disorder NEVER assessed - PRIMARY BREACH focus refocused accordingly.
